Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah took two wickets on his return to international cricket
Barry McCarthy and Curtis Campher led a fightback for Ireland, putting up 57 runs off 44 balls for the seventh wicket
Curtis Campher fell for 39 off 33 balls
Barry McCarthy ended unbeaten on 51 off 33 balls
Ireland set India a target of 140 to chase
Yashasvi Jaiswal and Ruturaj Gaikwad got India off to a flier, but India lost two wickets in the first over after the powerplay rain came in
The match was called off due to rain, with India leading by 2 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Jasprit Bumrah and Paul Sterling shook hands under umbrellas to conclude the match
India goes 1-0 up in the series
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain washed out most of the Indian innings
The covers were firmly in place as the rain got heavier
The umpires led the players off when the rain became persistent
